ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a variety of exercises and techniques for healthier and more natural singing. I improved my ability to reflect on my own vocal production and notice patterns of physical strain and improper support. I had the opportunity to sing repertoire outside of my normal practice, experiencing new musical styles.
I felt myself settle into violin playing, reimagining my bow technique, my vibrato, and more to help me relax while playing and performing.
I improved my technical and musical ability in violin performance.
I mostly was able to keep up my skills from before
I gained skills and grew as a musician and performer.
Technique! Worked on proper breathing, onset of vocal cords it's been awesome
How to sing and navigate my range!

I learned a lot about fundamentals of vocal technique and health that I definitely should know at my level of choir. It was a very useful experience and I can tell I grew a lot. I am able to sing substantially higher now than when I started lessons.
I learned more about playing cello, especially solo repertoire.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The strengths of this course are the support from your studioin playing studio classes, your friends and fellow musicians encourage you and give helpful constructive feedback to help you improve, as you do for them.

I cannot think of a weakness for this course; you get out of it what you put into it.
The course is pretty much exactly as expected. There are no specific things I would seek to improve.
Great teacher!
Strengths: everything

Strengths - love my voice teacher.
Weaknesses - I need to structure my rehearsal time more for sure.
My teacher could not consistently schedule lessons, and the schedule got a little scattered and we at times ended up behind on lessons.
My professor was great. Very understanding but very effective at teaching. It's also great how flexible the class times are.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to any Yale College musician looking to improve their technique and musicianship. This is a wonderful opportunity to do so.
I would absolutely recommend this course to another student if they wish to maintain or improve upon training with a musical instrument from high school in a more regular setting.
Yes, my teacher was fantastic and Ive learned a lot this semester.
Yes, if they are interested in maintaining solo musicianship
Yes! Any student interested in music lessons should apply for lessons for credit.
Absolutely... becoming a better musician using your yale tuition..? Why not hello
Absolutely. The grad student teachers here are incredible and I've learned so much through lessons for credit.
Yes - one of the best things about Yale.
Yes! Its a great feeling to see yourself personally improving in voice technique and being able to do things you couldnt do in the past.

Yes, definitely! Lessons are very important for feeling on tol of yourself as a musician and help with self esteem as well as music skills. They are a relatively light workload so they can supplement a high workload schedule nicely for balance.
Yes, Professor Akahoshi is a professor that will leave quite a positive impact on his students. The class is low pressure aside from whatever the student wants.
